text: The Justice for All Party of North Carolina (JFA NC) is an independent political party in North Carolina. It emerged as a political rival of the dominant Democratic Party and Republican Party during the 2024 United States elections. The party was founded in 2024 by a group of voters who oppose the two-party system. == 2024 Elections == The Justice for All Party of North Carolina nominated Cornel West for President of the United States and Frankie L. Gist for Mayor of Winston-Salem to stand for election in 2024. The Party obtained enough signatures to access the North Carolina ballot, but was denied recognition by the North Carolina State Board of Elections. Recognition of the party was opposed by the North Carolina Democratic Party, Clear Choice Action, and Marc Elias.https://s3.amazonaws.com/dl.ncsbe.gov/State_Board_Meeting_Docs/2024-06-26/New%20Party%20Petitions/Objections/NC%20Letter%20Re%20County%20Failure%20to%20Signature%20Check.pdf On July 2024, they sued the North Carolina State Board of Elections in federal court asking to be placed on the ballot and alleging a violation of their First Amendment rights. In August 2024, the United States District Court for the Eastern District of North Carolina ordered the North Carolina State Board of Elections to recognize the Justice for All Party and place their candidates on the ballot. ==References == Category:Political parties in the United States Category:Organizations based in North Carolina
title: Justice for All Party of North Carolina
